In addition to bricks, clays are used in a range of diverse applications in the built environment.

Serving also an important aesthetic role, tiles and their glazes are as diverse as the raw materials used to produce them. Here we will look at the various types of tiles and their processing, including earthenware, stoneware and importantly porcelain. We focus on porcelain and examine its application in the manufacturing of sanitaryware (toilets and sinks) sometimes known as whiteware. Vitreous porcelain ceramics are ubiquitous in the built environment, as nearly every structure, whether wood, stone, brick or concrete, always needs at least one bathroom.
